column9: After taking 1-1/2 bottles i started having alot of stomach pains and discomfort as with some mild female problems that seems to of ceased since i quit taking it.

column2: MO, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on this for one year and lost 2 stone, however I have never been offered any blood tests or vitamins and now have been really ill with pancreatis, and I have noticed this has occurred in a  few people who have been on this a long time. I now feel really ill. I WOULDNT ADVISE TAKING IT FOR A LONG TIME

So I have decided to just increase the intensity of my workouts.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
tgb, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Very pleased so far losing 10 pounds in two weeks, obviously with diet and exercise in the mix.Your body will let you know if you've exceeded your fat and calorie in take for the day,if so, be sure to stay close to the bathroom! I would highly recommend this product.

column2: SanctFied, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: If you are considering using this for the first 3 weeks DO NOT Eat a mass amount of fat. If in the event you do - (this may sound gross) but make sure you are squatted over a toilet when you feel the need to flatulate. Orlistat does a wonderful job in seperating the fat cells to the point you will see it. Even after 24 hours of non-use it will continue (so keep this in mind as well).All that to say no diet works, this requires a change of lifestyle habits and exercise. I have eatten everything I like to eat. I lost 22 lbs in the begining 3 months because I mis-read and thought it was 19g of fat per day, but it was per meal. (based on weight).But instead of having 1/2 the pie of pizza, have 2 slices and a salad. Again lifestyl change.. Does not sound "manly" when watching a football game, but I for one am willing to sacrafice the "image" of manlihood to live longer...

column2: mrs.benaka, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: ive been on the Alli program for almost a week ive had some side affects but not too much as to where i couldnt handle it...and my sideaffects were do to the act that i work at a club that serves fast food and bbq food so im getting a lot more grease in my diet than normal people im guessing but its working....the only side effect ive had is oily stools....id recommend this program to all of my friends desiring to lse weight to get to a healthy range...nothing else i tried worked...this does!!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking Orlistat about two months ago and I have lost 12 lbs.  I am very satisfied with my weight loss and how easy it has been so far.  Because of this drug I am much more aware of the foods that I eat and am more health conscious too when feeding my three children.  I have had very few side effects (lose stool) and  it isn't as bad as the label suggest.  If you want to lose weight and learn to eat right try Orlistat today.  You will be happy you did.

column2: Mitzzy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Really just started.  My belly has already decreased.  I don't feel as bloated.

column2: Fiona, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had a gradual weight loss on Orlistat and it takes a bit of getting used to but I am managing OK now you really have to watch your fat intake. I have lost a stone and a half in 3 months.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: I've been using alli for almost 2 weeks and have lost 8lbs. I'll say that the side effects don't seem to effect me and not even when the meal contains more then the 30% fat. For those of us how need a push or shove like in my case, this drug is for you. It will help you to loose more weight quicker and when your working so hard you want to see the results. And results will keep you on track. Im hoping to loose 65lbs. in 6 mon. Im thinking with alli I'll do it in less time.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I purchased this drug in the over-the-counter form called ALLI. I have been extremely happy with the weight loss progress I've made with no significant side effects. My goal was to get back into a healthy BMI, and I can see definite progress not to mention I feel better too. I highly recommend it, and at $50 for a 3 months supply I feel it's a good value.

column9: I lost over 50 lbs three years ago, and I am there again.

column9: I've been using orlistat for 5 months and have dropped 36 lbs. It's slow going, but for the first time in my life I'm losing weight slowly and steadily.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: i have been taking for 3 weeks now i have seen some weight loss

column2: Nibs, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: after going to the gym three times a week for over 12 months and not shifting a single pound and having the usual blood tests for diebetes etc my doctor prescribed orlistat, after 3 weeks of being on orlistat i have lost weight (6 lbs) which is amazing.  If you think yeh i can eat what i want and loose weight your wrong this drug makes you think about what your eating and i think overall it teaches you to have a better diet day to day.  If you go to your local fast food resuarant and your taking orlistat you will have nasty side effects, however if you eat low fat you will loose the pounds and have little to no side effects.
